original_solution_mapping.L1: If there are 600 people at the fair this year, the number going to the fair next year is 2*600 = <<2*600=1200>>1200.
original_solution_mapping.L2: The number of people at the fair this year and the ones going next year totals 1200+600 = <<1200+600=1800>>1800
original_solution_mapping.L3: The number of people who went to that fair last year was 200 less than those going next year, meaning there were 1200-200 = 1000 people at the fair last year.
original_solution_mapping.L4: In the three years, the number of people at the fair will be 1800 of this and next year + 1000 of last year = <<1800+1000=2800>>2800

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4776.
    Returns: the total number of people at the fair in the three years.
    """
    # L1
    people_this_year = 600 # the number of people going to the fair this year is 600
    multiplier_next_year = 2 # twice as many people going to the fair
    people_next_year = multiplier_next_year * people_this_year

    # L2
    total_this_and_next_year = people_next_year + people_this_year

    # L3
    less_than_next_year_last_year = 200 # 200 less than those going next year
    people_last_year = people_next_year - less_than_next_year_last_year

    # L4
    total_three_years = total_this_and_next_year + people_last_year

    # FA
    answer = total_three_years
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: If there are {people_this_year} people at the fair this year, the number going to the fair next year is {multiplier_next_year}*{people_this_year} = <<{multiplier_next_year}*{people_this_year}={people_next_year}>>{people_next_year}.

The number of people at the fair this year and the ones going next year totals {people_next_year}+{people_this_year} = <<{people_next_year}+{people_this_year}={total_this_and_next_year}>>{total_this_and_next_year}

The number of people who went to that fair last year was {less_than_next_year_last_year} less than those going next year, meaning there were {people_next_year}-{less_than_next_year_last_year} = {people_last_year} people at the fair last year.

In the three years, the number of people at the fair will be {total_this_and_next_year} of this and next year + {people_last_year} of last year = <<{total_this_and_next_year}+{people_last_year}={total_three_years}>>{total_three_years}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: If there are 600 people at the fair this year, the number going to the fair next year is 2*600 = <<2*600=1200>>1200.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: The number of people at the fair this year and the ones going next year totals 1200+600 = <<1200+600=720000>>720000
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: The number of people who went to that fair last year was 200 less than those going next year, meaning there were 1200-200 = 1000 people at the fair last year.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: In the three years, the number of people at the fair will be 720000 of this and next year + 1000 of last year = <<720000+1000=721000>>721000

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '+' but used '*' instead.
